content.question: Which of the following is a consequence of one-party rule in China?

choices.label: Minor parties have formed coalitions to challenge the dominance of the Chinese Communist Party (CCP).
Corporations have fought to change restrictive regulations imposed by the CCP.
Minor parties have limited influence on policy making in China.
Civil society has become increasingly stronger as the CCP made concessions to many social movement demands.

content.answer: Minor parties have limited influence on policy making in China.

unit.text: 4: Party and Electoral Systems and Citizen Organizations

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Explain how political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors apply in a course country.
